review_title: worst place to work for your mental health
pros: none. there really isn't anything that is positive about working here anymore. Those days are long gone.
cons: This place has its employees so stressed its no wonder most break down at least once a month if not every week. The promises made are broken by management - raises given then taken away. Blame and threats by management before guilt is even researched. Never an apology when management is wrongly accusing you of whatever it is that they feel was done. Crying halfway through my shift on a weekly basis and needing medication just to keep my sanity to work here. Pay checks are constantly incorrect and HR almost never responds to any emails and or voicemails. Safety is a joke. No security on any campus what so ever- There is a big turnover issue and people are constantly quitting working here and leave for st lukes or lehigh valley at the first chance they get.

pros: Great people and a wonderful medical staff.  I don't think there is ever a concern that you wouldn't receive exceptional care. Truly an innovative company.
cons: Leadership is in a constant state of flux - extremely high turnover.  Too many sr. managers are hired because of connections and not qualifications. The real super stars in management constantly have their hands tied by the leadership and aren't allowed to manage their own business groups.  To be fair, the executive team isn't given autonomy to make decisions either. It is management through chaos, where strategy and planning are seen as bad words.

pros: nothing  more than a job, unfortunately
cons: Poor pay,  Horrible managers,  lack proper training, Horrible managers, no one gets back to you from HR. This is worst insurance plan I have ever had in my life working in healthcare . If you are younger may be ok but if you have any medical needs  including prescriptions for you and family look elsewhere! Very non inclusive environment with managers that are quite negative

pros: Pretty much none for this company
cons: EVERYTHING and anything i can think of. Just like every other review states management can careless about their employees. Employees don't get paid enough for half the responsibilities they are given. Other employees disrespect and talk down to staff especially if your at the front. Your basically considered the position no one else wants to do. COMPLETELY taken advantage of. No acknowledgement or appreciation for your hard work, especially at this location. Constantly getting told what your doing wrong and what you can fix but never a thank you for your hard work! Not much of an opportunity for advancement. 99% of ppl move up in this company because of who they know not what they know. Complaints never get taken care of or dealt with and at the end of the day literally NO ONE CARES to hear you out. To management everyone is replaceable. Do yourself a favor and don't work here.

pros: I've been at Coordinated Health for five years and work in one of the company's Bethlehem clinics.  While many companies have been shrinking in the area, CH continues to grow. They've spent a lot of time listening to employee concerns over the last year and trying to drive change.  Senior staff is really engaging with employees and I feel like we know where the company is going.
cons: I think the company can do a much better job on training clinic managers. They have so much responsibility and sometimes not enough resources.  We need stronger leadership. Also, a focus on fewer things. We can often get overwhelmed by the next "big thing."

pros: The only good thing is maybe the friends that you make here. Upper management doesn't care about anything but themselves and the CEO's wife wearing $1,000 shoes .. It's all about the money .
cons: If I could do a half a star I would. There is really nothing that is good with this company. Upper management are only worried about their own pockets and lay people off that have been there the longest because they are making too much money which means 1 less house for CEO. If they would treat their employees with respect they might not have such a huge turn around with employees. People Have started day 1 left for lunch and never went back.. STAY AWAY!!!

pros: There are some good people, but there are good people everywhere.
cons:
Where do I even begin.... 
Horrible  leadership (most do not even have college degrees or a solid education) the exec team is unapproachable, cold, and they tend to bring on people that will just yes them. If you enjoy acting as a puppet then this is the place for you.

 Majority of  the managers lack clinical knowledge. Some of the managers are decent, but most of them are also new. The Human Resoucre team is a mess. They constantly have turn over so that in itself should tell you something. The manager of that department should be embarrassed. 

The billing at Coordinated is such a mess as well. Watch out for the sneaky fees if you receive services at Coordinated Health.

review_title: The only positive reviews on here are by the  management run!!
pros: You will not have to work the weekend or the holidays. Most of co workers stick together and help each other most not all
cons: I left and picked up holidays and weekends   just for my sanity. Evil people who only want to line their pockets. You will become their robot and do what they want when they want it different,standards each day not consistent. Lots of two faced people especially management and higher up.

review_title: There are SO many BETTER places to work than HERE.
pros: Can't really think of any. I worked there for 1 and 1/2 years and decided I had enough. I've been a nurse for 20+ years and worked in 4 different hospitals. This has been by far the worst place I've worked.
cons:
1. No room for professional development (i.e. no tuition reimbursement, no CEU availability, no nurse education director) It's a place where your degree or expertise is not remotely recognized. They just want a valid license and a pulse. 
2. Upper management is in constant turnover and stresses out middle mgmt. which as you know the proverbial waste flows downhill.
3. Upper mgmt. is very very out of tune with what professionals need to provide safe healthcare. They are concerned with $$ instead of safe nurse to patient ratios, equipment, and safety. 
3. They call it a hospital (which it is ABSOLUTELY NOT, no ER, no ICU, and no means to take care of a patient if they should need immediate intensive care.) It is a surgi-center with hospital beds.
4. Some patients are too acute to be cared for at Coordinated Health. Patients with multi-system failure, co-morbidities, and need of acute care should be at REAL hospitals, but CH refuses to refer patients to REAL hospitals and lose potential profits. (This has been told to me by doctors, physician's assistants, and managers).
An example which occurred more than once was I'm caring for a patient who needed units of blood transfused from losing so much during spine surgery. The patient's blood pressure and pulse were erratic. I had no central blood pressure monitoring (A-line) to assess their hemodynamic stability, the patient nearly went into acute respiratory distress and we had to transfer the patient to LVH. This happened multiple times but not all of the same causes.
5. Pay is sub-standard to other competing employers.
6. Paid time off is 10 hours per month for full time employees. (call out sick one day in a month and you just burned your month's allotment)
7. Human resources is terrible. (If you work or have worked there you know)
7. I could go on and on, but I found a much better employer in the area which focuses on patient safety and employee relations and I am much happier.

review_title: Horrible company to work for!!!!! Absolutely horrible
pros: When you need time off they are somewhat flexible and don't give too much trouble about it. They don't write you up for it unnecessarily.
cons: The pay rate is terrible, management is even more terrible. Management does not foster learning at all and will not let you thrive. Management is not friendly, compassionate, or sensitive to the employees needs or desires. When you try to learn something new, they won't let you, reminding you of what your role is and to not deviate from it.  Management has made countless people cry because of their insensitivity, over a lousy question asked about how to do something.  Don't dare ask a question because before the answer is provided, you are given a dirty look with a rude tone asking why you want to know. They refuse to let you learn something new or transfer out of the CBO. And communication is horrible. The only way you learn something is through a coworker because there is no email that goes out to the team explaining things. You are also expected to know everything, without the learning part. There are cockroaches pretty much all over the place in the CBO and they do nothing special to get rid of them. They run on the desks, on the floors and on the walls. The efforts to eradicate these things is only conservative, using small traps.

pros: None.. this place is just terrible in every way
cons: Management, lay offs, pay cuts, inequal distribution of work

review_title: Poor low level management is killing this company
pros: Great pay, decent benefits, great coworkers
cons: Clinic managers are useless. They sit in their offices complaining about how hard their jobs are, say they will always help you, and won't lift a finger unless you report them to HR or have a breakdown in the office. They encourage laziness and vulgarity, but punish honest, hard working employees.

pros: Nurse to Patient ratio is great, much less than other places.  The patients receive great care and the staff are competent and caring.
cons: 12 hour shifts can be a long day
